column4: i would like to have azureus loading at startup, how could i do that?
my azureus is just an executable, i must run it at a terminal every time
is there a way to get azureus as a normal programm?
what do you mean i can not quite understand
i mean it is just a shell script that i have to load on a terminal to run it.. i dont have it on the programms menu
any program that you run is an executable that you can run in a terminal. unluss you need special env. var for azures
just give it the right path
where do you run azurus from which dir
you can also execute it as !/programms/azuresus/azureus
sorry ment you can also execute it as ~/programms/azuresus/azureus
just put it this way in your startup programs list and it will work
i closed azureus and tried to opened it with ~/programms/azuresus/azureus in the terminal, but it says "No such file or directory
use tab complettion will me much easier this way
